summary: Dawne C. Miller was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She is listed in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978. These documents provide her name, and in some cases, her salary and social security number, indicating her employment during the specified periods. The documents suggest she was a staff member of the SCAS during its investigation.
significance: Dawne C. Miller's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination, albeit in a staff role. The specific nature of her role is not detailed in the provided documents.
